The FHLT and FMLT vehicles use advanced ducted turbofans, which are powered by compact AMC (Aneutronic Magnetic Confinement) fusion generators. This cutting-edge technology allows for efficient, clean, and powerful propulsion systems that do not rely on fossil fuels or combustion engines.

AMC fusion generators harness the power of nuclear fusion, combining light atomic nuclei to form heavier nuclei and releasing a tremendous amount of energy in the process. This energy is then used to power the ducted turbofans, providing the FHLT and FMLT with impressive speed, range, and lifting capabilities.

The use of fusion power in the FHLT and FMLT is in line with the forest moon colony's commitment to sustainability and environmental protection. By utilizing clean, renewable energy sources for their vehicles, the colony is able to maintain its pristine environment and serve as a model for other civilizations seeking to adopt greener technologies and practices.
